selected_quotes: Study finds many non-urgent visits actually encompass high-acuity medical care
5.7% of NON-urgent ED visits resulted in admission/transfer vs 14.9% of urgent visits
5% ESI5 admitted; hard to find low acuity
Urgent Needs Among Nonurgent ED Visits out today.
Do #patients triaged as nonurgent in #EDs have #diagnostics, procedures and get admitted?

news.title: Patients triaged as nonurgent in ED get diagnostics, procedures, admitted
news.summary: Some patients triaged as nonurgent in emergency departments (EDs) still received diagnostic services, had procedures performed and were admitted, including to critical care units, all of which could signal overuse, a lack of primary care physicians…

news.title: 'Nonurgent' patients might still end up being hospitalized

news.title: Chest Pain is Common but Actual Severity is Rare
news.summary: UCSF Study Finds that Most Visits to ER for Chest Pain are Not Life -Threatening Chest pain is one of the most common reasons to visit the emergency room, but a new UC San Francisco study shows that only a fraction of all cases actually lead to a…

facebook.title: Urgent Care Needs Among Nonurgent Visits to the Emergency Department
facebook.summary:
Urgent Care Needs Among Nonurgent Visits to the ED 

The rhetoric behind the term nonurgent has been often politicized to mean inappropriate, which has implications for both the patient and health care system when these 2 terms are conflated. http://ja.ma/
